basic_info.description: The intersection of technology and physical experiences has always fascinated me. I consider myself incredibly lucky to have grown up at a crossroads of technology. I was fortunate enough to have a childhood filled with bike rides, soccer games, imaginative play, tree-climbing, and adventures in the woods behind my house. Back then, my only technology was a Nintendo on a blocky CRT TV, and even then, it was beautiful in its simplicity. However, with the advent of the internet, everything changed. I can still recall the exhilarating feeling of logging onto AIM after dinner to chat with my friends, a feeling that was only surpassed by the arrival of the iPhone in my 20s.The beautiful marriage of analog and digital has been my passion, and I take pride in providing tailored solutions to clients that help them achieve their goals.   By being in the middle of this intersection between technology and tangible physical skills, I am able to create innovative and unique solutions that bring together the best of both worlds.   I believe that technology has the power to enhance our physical experiences, and I am thrilled to be a part of this exciting era where anything is possible.

projects.title: The Points Guy
projects.description: As a web developer at thepointsguy.com, I maintain and build web UI improvements and features for a PHP, JavaScript, and React-driven credit card rewards and travel site. With more than 35 new and updated daily posts, we serve over 8 million unique monthly visitors.In my role, I lead TPG’s UI rebranding and overhaul initiative and spearheaded the build for our Best Cards page. I also created personalized experiences using proprietary software for A/B testing and decisioning based on tests, user agent information, and rules.

projects.title: CreditCards.com
projects.description: As part of a small team of developers, I helped build and maintain creditcards.com. During my time there, I was part of the team responsible for the rebrand initiative. I frequently worked on fetching and manipulating data from our credit cards API to provide dynamic results to our end users.

projects.title: Jugo Austin
projects.description: I created a web interface that incorporates the typography and graphics of the brand's hierarchies, along with subtle animations and generous white space, to replicate the in-person experience on the digital platform.

projects.title: Shed Barber
projects.description: One of the first apps I was working on my internship. I had to develop front-end implementation for app that shows 3D models of known buildings. This was also my first project in Angular framework. I've learned a lot!

projects.title: Specht Architects
projects.description: Personal project for study subject. I was responsible for testing photography application that optimizes images with popular algorithms used by graphic editors like Pixlr or Adobe Photoshop. I've earned A grade :)

projects.title: Big Red Sun
projects.description: In the early stages of my career as a developer, I was assigned the task of creating a website that would stand out for my client, Big Red Sun. To achieve this, I utilized the latest HTML and CSS best practices and took advantage of WordPress' powerful customization features. The end result was a distinctive website that perfectly matched the client's brand.
